title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:23 <mflorea> has quit  
00:25 <jvdrean> has quit  
02:39 <sburjan`> has quit  
03:17 <DrLou> has quit  
05:16 <JuanDaugherty> has quit  
06:35 <Denis> has quit  
06:35 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
07:01 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
07:03 <Denis> has quit  
07:48 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:07 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
08:09 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:11 <vmassol> mflorea: hi, skype ping. I think I've found some issues yesterday with the new sheet system and I'd like to talk to you about them to discuss what can be done  
08:11 <+mflorea> vmassol: ok, should we talk here or on skype?  
08:12 <vmassol> skype (I'd like voice talk)  
08:12 <+mflorea> ok  
08:32 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <vmassol> why does platform build seems to pick agent3 all the time?  
09:42 <vmassol> (on jenkins)  
09:42 <vmassol> I just clicked build on platform and it gets executed on agent3  
09:44 <+tmortagne> vmassol: it's not exactly all the time but jenkins tend to reuse always the same agent for the same job when possible  
09:45 <vmassol> you mean the last agent where it ran?  
09:45 <vmassol> that would explain it indeed  
09:45 <+tmortagne> yep I think it's the last  
09:47 <vmassol> myxwiki.org just restarted it sees  
10:13 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
11:44 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
11:47 <+mflorea> vmassol: I have to go now, I'll be offline for the rest of the afternoon but I'll be back in the evening  
11:50 <mflorea> has quit  
12:31 <vmassol> sdumitriu: just tried a git checkout xwiki-commons-3.2-milestone-3 and I have the same problem as yesterday  
12:33 <+tmortagne> vmassol: you probably need to fetch tags  
12:33 <+tmortagne> I can see https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/tree/xwiki-commons-3.2-milestone-3 is here  
12:33 <vmassol> i have the tag that's not the problem  
12:34 <vmassol> but when I check it out if I verify the top level pom it contains 3.2-SNAPSHOT  
12:34 <+tmortagne> ok I tough you were talking about tag not here issue  
12:34 <vmassol> that said https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/blob/xwiki-commons-3.2-milestone-3/pom.xml seems ok  
12:34 <vmassol> so it must be some refresh issue  
12:34 <+tmortagne> yep  
12:34 <vmassol> but I did a git pull —rebase  
12:34 <vmassol> isn't that refreshing my whole repo?  
12:34 <+tmortagne> not sure pull deal with tags  
12:35 <vmassol> prolly not apparently  
12:35 <+tmortagne> that's why I told you to specifillay fetch tags  
12:35 <vmassol> trying git fetch --tags  
12:35 <vmassol> indeed:  
12:35 <vmassol> vmassol@vincent-massols-macbook-pro ~/dev/xwiki/git/xwiki-commons (master) $ git fetch --tags  
12:35 <vmassol> remote: Counting objects: 110, done.  
12:35 <vmassol> remote: Compressing objects: 100% (28/28), done.  
12:35 <vmassol> remote: Total 59 (delta 30), reused 59 (delta 30)  
12:35 <vmassol> Unpacking objects: 100% (59/59), done.  
12:35 <vmassol> From github.com:xwiki/xwiki-commons  
12:35 <vmassol>  - [tag update]      xwiki-commons-3.2-milestone-3 -> xwiki-commons-3.2-milestone-3  
12:36 <vmassol> works  
12:36 <vmassol> thanks  
12:37 <+tmortagne> cool it works since I sounds a bid weird to update a tags that is supposed to be read only thing  
12:37 <+tmortagne> but since it's just a pointer I guess git does not care and it's just a convention to not touch it like with svn  
12:39 <vmassol> yes  
13:44 <pturcotte> has quit  
14:11 <vmassol> I have a staging repo for xwiki comons 3.2M3: https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/orgxwiki-053/  
14:11 <vmassol> going to release it in a few seconds… which means it'll get synced to maven central  
14:12 <vmassol> (will do the rendering 3.2M3 later if it succeeds)  
14:15 <vmassol> done, we're now here: https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/releases/org/xwiki/commons/  
14:22 <vmassol> for the record I've had to cheat a bit...  
14:23 <vmassol> we're currently violating a central repo rule…2 of our artifacts don't have a javadoc jar generated  
14:23 <vmassol> because they only contain internal code and we don't generate javadoc for internal code  
14:24 <vmassol> right now the only workaround I can find is to add a build step for those modules and use the antrun plugin to create a target/apidocs directory….  
14:25 <vmassol> (which will make the javadoc plugin gneerate an "empty'" javadoc jar)  
14:25 <vmassol> I've looked at the sources of the javadoc plugin and it won't generate anything if there's no java files matching  
14:54 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
15:08 <pturcotte> has quit  
15:10 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
15:57 <JuanDaugherty> has joined #xwiki  
15:59 <JuanDaugherty> in 3.1, if you're logging into the main wiki in a farm, you're logged into all the virtual wikis.  
16:02 <+tmortagne> JuanDaugherty: not sure what you mean  
16:03 <JuanDaugherty> but logging out of a virtual doesn't log you out of the main, at least as admin. tmortagne, just trynna get clear on what's happening with sessions in a farm, presume this is only for admin accounts  
16:06 <+tmortagne> JuanDaugherty: it's not exactly that, when you log in main wiki you put information in a cookie to log in automatically next time  
16:06 <+tmortagne> when you go to another wiki the cookie is read and you are automatically logged in  
16:06 <JuanDaugherty> without user approval?  
16:07 <+tmortagne> didn't you ticked "remember me" ?  
16:07 <JuanDaugherty> convention is to ask  
16:07 <JuanDaugherty> no ??????’?  
16:08 <+tmortagne> is it a domain based wiki farm or path based ?  
16:09 <JuanDaugherty> has quit  
16:09 <JuanDaugherty> has joined #xwiki  
16:09 <JuanDaugherty> sorry xchat fucks up like that sometimes  
16:10 <JuanDaugherty> it is domain based  
16:10 <+tmortagne> ok then I'm not sure, maybe the cookie is set anyway  
16:11 <+tmortagne> as far as I remember I usually have to reconnect to each wiki but it's maybe new in 3.1  
16:11 <JuanDaugherty> you mean pre 3.2 don't you  
16:12 <JuanDaugherty> because I never heard of xwikie before 3.1  
16:12 <JuanDaugherty> \*xwiki  
16:12 <vmassol> tmortagne: seems something has changed because for me too I had to reconnect when going to subwikis. I even think that's the case on myxwiki.org  
16:13 <@sdumitriu> JuanDaugherty: Cookie domains  
16:13 <@sdumitriu> Check xwiki.cfg  
16:16 <JuanDaugherty> I always have that empty  
16:19 <JuanDaugherty> (i.e. "xwiki.authentication.cookiedomains=" , not commented out )  
16:31 <@sdumitriu> What do you want? To disable logging in in all wikis at once, or to keep the global login but make logout work correctly?  
16:34 <JuanDaugherty> logout does appear to work correctly  
16:35 <JuanDaugherty> the bad thing would be if a non admin user of a subwiki was logged into another subwiki  
16:36 <JuanDaugherty> don't care if admin user is logged into all, which does appear to be the case (though logout is honored)  
16:48 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Failing tests on platform  
16:50 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: I know I just fixed it  
16:50 <@sdumitriu> K  
17:10 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
17:13 <+lucaa> guys, if the fix for  XWIKI-6754: Flickering Javascript errors and issues due to bad initialisation  at https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/6fbd314c7c23eeb15e29b35421b3a14b8605373b  is also fixing the issue with "environment prevented table from loading data" in the livetables, could we backport it to 3.1 as well?  
17:15 <+lucaa> the livetable issue is \_really\_ annoying  
17:15 <+tmortagne> hmm packager build is broken in 3.1, that's weird  
17:19 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
17:21 <+tmortagne> ha found another retro-compatibility bug with context user  
17:23 <evalica> has quit  
17:28 <JuanDaugherty> is skin editor park of the enterprise pkg? I don't remember installing it.  
17:29 <JuanDaugherty> when you export and specify a pkg name, how does that map to programming? Is it implicitly the whole wiki?  
17:33 <JuanDaugherty> (i.e. all xwiki objects to the bounding wiki/db scope)
